definition: number plate/car license plate/CL:條|条[tiao2],塊|块[kuai4],片[pian4]
ordinal number/day of a month/mark/sign/business establishment/size/ship suffix/horn (wind instrument)/bugle call/assumed name/to take a pulse/classifier used to indicate number of people
roar/cry/CL:個|个[ge4]
weight/number/code/to pile/to stack/classifier for length or distance (yard), happenings etc
mahjong tile/playing card/game pieces/signboard/plate/tablet/medal/CL:片[pian4],個|个[ge4],塊|块[kuai4]

sentences.english: You will need to take a number slip and wait for your turn.
sentences.chinese: 你需要先抽號碼牌，並依序等候服務。

sentences.english: Numbers will be assigned to each participant.
sentences.chinese: 每個選手將收到號碼牌。

sentences.english: I'd like to open an account in your bank. Should I take a number first?
sentences.chinese: 我念正在您們銀止開戶。我要先與號碼牌嗎？

sentences.english: Didn't you receive the claim tags when you checked in?
sentences.chinese: 你在搭機檢查櫃檯上有沒有收到號碼牌？

sentences.english: The bank is always crowded at lunchtime. You'll have to take a number.
sentences.chinese: 銀行在午餐時間人都很多，你要抽號碼牌。

sentences.english: I am in line holding the number I took for love.
sentences.chinese: 我排著隊拿著愛的號碼牌。

sentences.english: Yes, these are my baggage claim checks.
sentences.chinese: 有，這是我的行李號碼牌。

sentences.english: A $100 HKD charge may apply for completion of this bib transfer.
sentences.chinese: 我們將收取港幣$100元作號碼牌轉讓費用。

sentences.english: Please put your medicine in a basket, and take away the number.
sentences.chinese: 請把你的藥放於籃子裏，並取走號碼牌。

sentences.english: The letter at Counter 6 will pay you against your number slip.
sentences.chinese: 六號櫃檯的出納員將根據你的號碼牌付給你錢。

sentences.english: I'd like to open an account at your bank. Should I take a number first?
sentences.chinese: 我想在你們銀行開個戶。我要先取號碼牌嗎？

sentences.english: The teller at counter 3 will pay you against your number SLIP .
sentences.chinese: 三號櫃檯的出納員會根據您的號碼牌付錢給您。

definition: variant of 櫃檯|柜台[gui4 tai2]
(at a restaurant) to order a meal/(of a waiter) to take an order
to pay the bill/to settle accounts/also written 結賬|结账
departure gate (aviation)
departure (of a coach or train)/to dispatch a vehicle
to accept delivery of goods/to pick up goods
class timetable
to reserve a seat/to book a table/reservation
to line up
boarding pass
take-out (fast food)/(outer part of) tire/as well/besides/into the bargain/outer zone
to inspect a ticket/to examine a ballot
attendant on an airplane, train, boat etc
cabin of a plane
to assign sb to a seat/to be allocated a place
service desk/information desk/reception desk
